 June 8, 2006
 Judge Rules Oregon Lawsuit Against the Vatican Can Proceed 
 By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
 A federal judge in Portland ruled that a sexual abuse lawsuit against the Vatican can move forward with its claim that the Holy See bears responsibility for a priest transferred from city to city even though he was known to be a molester. The judge, Michael Mosman of Federal District Court, said that there were exceptions to the Foreign Sovereign Immunities Act, under which the Vatican is typically immune from the jurisdiction of American courts. Rejecting the church's bid to dismiss the case, Judge Mosman ruled that there was enough of a connection between the Vatican and the priest, the Rev. Andrew Ronan, who died in 1970, for him to be considered a Vatican employee under Oregon law.
